choices.C: Enable a web filter security profile on the Full Access firewall policy.
choices.D: Enable Log Allowed Traffic on the Full Access firewall policy.

questions.question_text: Which two settings must you configure to ensure FortiGate generates logs for web filter activity on a firewall policy called Full Access? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A,C & D are correct - FGT_Infrastructure-6.2, p. 58

comments.content:
it's ok Polly --> A,C,D pag FGT_Infrastructure-6.4, p. 57 
 Level 3 - Ip header, payload and ethernet Header
 Level 5 - Ip header, payload and interface name

discussion.content: ABC - FGT_Infrastructure-6.2, p. 58. the same question #74 version 6.4

questions.question_text:
An administrator is running the following sniffer command:
diagnose sniffer packet any "host 10.0.2.10" 3
Which three items will be included in the sniffer output? (Choose three.)

choices.B: Run a sniffer on the web server.
choices.C: Execute another sniffer in the FortiGate, this time with the filter, "host 10.0.1.10".
choices.A: Capture the traffic using an external sniffer connected to port1.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

In the network shown in the exhibit, the web client cannot connect to the HTTP web server. The administrator runs the FortiGate built-in sniffer and gets the following output:
FortiGate # diagnose sniffer packet any "port 80" 4
interfaces=[any]
filters=[port 80]
11.510058 port3 in 10.0.1.10.49255 ->
10.200.1.254.80: syn 697263124
11.760531 port3 in 10.0.1.10.49256 ->
10.200.1.254.80: syn 868017830
14.505371 port3 in 10.0.1.10.49255 ->
10.200.1.254.80: syn 697263124
14.755510 port3 in 10.0.1.10.49256 ->
10.200.1.254.80: syn 868017830
What should the administrator do next to troubleshoot the problem?

choices.B: The port3 default route has the highest distance.
choices.A: The port3 default route has the lowest metric.
choices.D: The port1 and port2 default routes are active in the routing table.
choices.C: There will be eight routes active in the routing table.

discussion.content:
B & D are correct.
*> mean active routes
first square bracked mean administrative distance
second bracket square mean priority (valid only on static routes)
metric applies only in multiroutes with same administrative distance

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The exhibit shows admission control settings.
Which users and user groups are allowed access to the network through captive portal?

choices.B: Only individual users "" not groups "" defined in the captive portal configuration
choices.A: Groups defined in the captive portal configuration
choices.D: Users and groups defined in the firewall policy
